instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3115-B No Green light.
threads.message:
This  unit was liquid damaged,  green light turn off after 10 seconds.
SMC_ADAPTER_EN=3.4v

Pp3v42_g3h= 3.4v 
SMC_BC_ACOK= 3.3v

ADAPTER_SENSE =2.9v
sys_onewire= 2.9v
Ppbus_g3h =12.5 volt
CHRG_acin=3.9v 
Any help please??

threads.title: 820-3115-B No Green light.
threads.message:
Post U6900/01 voltages.
Did you try another DCIN board?
Does the board start?

threads.title: 820-3115-B No Green light.
threads.message:
U6900/01=3.47v
tried  another known good  DCIN board.
the board never start.

threads.title: 820-3115-B No Green light.
threads.message:
"U6900/01=3.47v"
What should I understand?
Each one has 5 pins...

threads.title: 820-3115-B No Green light.
threads.message:
U6900: P1 SMC_BC_ACOK_VCC=3.47V
P4, SYS_ONEWIRE=2.9V
P5, ADAPTER_SENSE=2.9V

U6901:    P1,2 ,  SMC_BC_ACOK=2.8v
p5,   PP3V42_G3H=3.47v
p4,   SMC_BC_ACOK_VCC=3.47v

threads.title: 820-3115-B No Green light.
threads.message:
SYS_ONEWIRE is a bit low; looks like SMC issue.
Where was the liquid spill?
Put good flux and reflow SMC...

threads.title: 820-3115-B No Green light.
threads.message: Liquid was around smc and bios. i reflow it, 200C tem and good flux, bought it from you guys.still it shows SYS_ONEWIRE=2.9V and no luck.

threads.title: 820-3115-B No Green light.
threads.message:
Reball SMC.
Next, check all SPI Bus Serie Termination resistors and trace/solders for U6100.

threads.title: 820-3115-B No Green light.
threads.message: Reball SMC and check all SPI termination resisters and tested ok. Unit works great. Thanks.
